Class Screen

java.lang.Object
com.group6.hms.framework.screens.Screen
All Implemented Interfaces:
ScreenLifeCycle
Direct Known Subclasses:
LoginScreen, OptionScreen, UpdatePatientMedicalScreen
public abstract class Screen extends Object implements ScreenLifeCycle
This class represent the Screen which can be display on to the ConsoleInterface

  • Constructor Details

    • Screen

      protected Screen(String title)
      Constructor to initialize the screen with a title.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the screen to be displayed as a header.

  • Method Details

    • setScreenManager

      protected void setScreenManager(ScreenManager screenManager)
      Sets the reference to the screen manager.
      Parameters:
      screenManager - The screen manager responsible for this screen.

    • setConsoleInterface

      protected void setConsoleInterface(ConsoleInterface consoleInterface)
      Sets the reference to the console interface.
      Parameters:
      consoleInterface - The console interface used to display this screen.

    • setPrintHeader

      protected void setPrintHeader(boolean printHeader)
      Configures whether the screen should print the header.
      Parameters:
      printHeader - true to print the header, false to disable it.

    • newScreen

      protected void newScreen(Screen newScreen)
      Start a new Screen with a new navigation stack
      Parameters:
      newScreen - the initial screen to display

    • navigateToScreen

      protected void navigateToScreen(Screen screen)
      Navigates to the specified screen.
      Parameters:
      screen - The next screen to navigate to.

    • navigateBack

      protected void navigateBack()
      Navigates back to the previous screen.

    • doNotLoopScreen

      protected void doNotLoopScreen()
      Do not display the screen again and will instead end the application once the screen exit

    • setCurrentTextConsoleColor

      public void setCurrentTextConsoleColor(ConsoleColor color)
      Sets the current text color in the console. The next print operation will use the color specified by color.
      Parameters:
      color - The ConsoleColor to set the text to.

    • setCurrentBackgroundConsoleColor

      public void setCurrentBackgroundConsoleColor(ConsoleColor color)
      Sets the current background color in the console. The next print operation will use the color as background specified by color.
      Parameters:
      color - The ConsoleColor to set the text to.

    • waitForKeyPress

      protected void waitForKeyPress()
      Wait for a key press from the current console.

    • readString

      protected String readString()
      Read a String from the current console.
      Returns:
      The string entered by the user.

    • readDouble

      protected double readDouble()
      Read a Double from the current console.
      Returns:
      The double entered by the user.

    • readInt

      protected int readInt()
      Read a int from the current console.
      Returns:
      The int entered by the user.

    • print

      protected void print(String s)
      Print a String to the current console.

    • println

      protected void println(String s)
      Print a String to the current console with a newline.

    • displayHeader

      protected void displayHeader(int totalWidth)
      Displays the screen header. This can be disabled using setPrintHeader(boolean). The header includes a title centered and wrapped with borders.
